intro: Polygonum fluviatile, commonly known as river smartweed, is a herbaceous annual plant native to wetland environments. It typically grows in shallow water or moist soils along riverbanks and stream edges. The plant has slender, erect stems that are often reddish in color, and its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and slightly hairy. Small clusters of pink to red flowers appear at the tips of the stems, and the plant produces small, three-lobed seeds. It is often found in temperate regions and is adaptable to a variety of wetland habitats.
